roleTypes.title: Creator
description: You write, draw, or make music
You've got ideas in your head and need somewhere to let them out
You're not afraid to be seen

roleTypes.title: Tech Enthusiast
description: See 'Entropic Scattering Particles' and immediately want to run the numbers
You like writing code and want to work on a real project
You think open source actually matters

roleTypes.title: Thinker
description: You lie awake at 2am wondering what consciousness actually is
You have your own take on life, existence, and freedom

roleTypes.title: Casual Participant
description: You just think this world is pretty cool
You want a place to hang out and chat
You don't have to do anything specific — just being here is enough

positive: People with their own ideas — even weird ones
People who aren't afraid to speak the truth

participationMethods.title: Take a look
participationMethods.description: Start with the stories. Get a feel for what this world is about and who's in it
items: Read the project overview — find out what ESAP is doing
Check out the tech specs — understand the world's underlying logic
Browse the character profiles — meet 1547, 1548, 1549
If you're curious, read the AP/EP story series

participationMethods.title: Speak up
participationMethods.description: Got thoughts? Share them. We don't bite (probably)
items: Something in the worldbuilding doesn't make sense? Say it
Got ideas for character development? Say it
Think a tech spec should be changed? Say it
Sudden burst of inspiration? Definitely say it

participationMethods.title: Get your hands dirty
participationMethods.description: Use whatever you're good at to add something to this world
items: Writing: character stories, slice-of-life, side stories
Visual: character art, scene design, graphics
Audio: compose, voice act, sound design
Code: this website itself is an open source project

participationMethods.title: Create a character
participationMethods.description: Design a character of your own and let them live in this world
items: Get the worldbuilding rules down first
Figure out who your character is, where they came from, where they're going
Submit to an admin, talk it through, adjust, then officially join

characterCreationSteps.title: Do your homework
items: Read through the worldbuilding docs
Know where the tech limits are
Know who the existing characters are

characterCreationSteps.title: Design your character
items: Basic info (name, designation, identity)
Personality — give them edges, don't make them perfect
Backstory — what have they been through
How do they relate to existing characters

characterCreationSteps.title: Submit
items: Reach out to an admin
Send over your character doc
Talk it through, make adjustments
Get approved and officially join

principles.title: Respect the lore
principles.description: The worldbuilding rules are maintained by everyone. Want to change something? Propose it. Don't just quietly rewrite things

principles.title: Stay independent
principles.quote: You are one of a kind in this world
principles.description: Your character should be yours. Not a reskin of 1547, not a clone of 1548. Be your own thing

principles.title: Be real
principles.quote: A mechanical heartbeat is still real
principles.description: Don't chase perfection. Flaws, contradictions, feelings you can't quite name — that's what makes it real

principles.title: Respect each other
principles.description: Other people's work deserves to be taken seriously. Disagree all you want, but don't make it personal

dos: Branch out into new tech areas
donts: Break fundamental physics rules (Entropic Particles have their own system)

recommended: Room to grow — don't start at max level
avoid: Mary Sue / Gary Stu (nobody buys a perfect character)
Pure plot devices (no personality = not a character)
Lore so complex even you can't explain it

communityValues.title: Independence
communityValues.quote: Don't let others control you, and don't let yourself control you either
communityValues.description: Everyone here is their own person. You can disagree. Nobody's getting kicked out for thinking differently

communityValues.title: Authenticity
communityValues.quote: A mechanical heartbeat is still real
communityValues.description: Be yourself. Imperfection is fine. Faking perfection is what's scary

communityValues.title: Hope
communityValues.quote: There were no stars in the sky, so we built one
communityValues.description: Don't wait for someone to save you. Do it yourself, even if it's just building one small satellite

communityValues.title: Connection
communityValues.quote: From I Am, to We Are
communityValues.description: Going alone is exhausting. Find each other, lean on each other, go a little further

faq.question: Can I join if I can't create stuff?
faq.answer: Yeah. Reading stories, chatting, giving feedback — that all counts. Creating isn't just drawing and writing.

faq.question: Can I create my own character?
faq.answer: Yes. Learn the worldbuilding first, design your character, submit for review, and you're in once approved. Process isn't complicated, but take it seriously.

faq.question: Do you pay?
faq.answer: No. ESAP is a non-profit open project. Everything is voluntary. If commercial opportunities come up down the road, we'll work out revenue sharing with creators.

faq.question: Who owns the copyright?
faq.answer: You do. Content published on ESAP follows CC-BY 4.0. You can share and use it freely, just credit the original author. Great work may get featured on the official site.

faq.question: Will the worldbuilding change?
faq.answer: Core lore stays stable. Details keep getting filled in. Big changes go through community discussion — nothing changes overnight.

faq.question: What if I want to leave?
faq.answer: Leave whenever you want. If your content has been woven into the worldbuilding, we'd like to keep it (with your name on it). But if you insist on removal, we respect that.

nextSteps: Say 'hey' — no need for a formal intro, just chat
Browse whatever interests you, speak up when you feel like it
If your hands are itching, write something, draw something, or open a PR

closing.message: ESAP is an open world. No fixed rules, no mandatory tasks, no one more important than anyone else. You can 'escape' from whatever has you trapped. You can be someone else's light. Or you can do nothing at all and just be here.
closing.invitation: If you're looking for a place — a place where you can be yourself, speak the truth, and connect with others. If you want to wish upon that satellite. Then come.
